      • appointmentAddButtonPushed

        public void appointmentAddButtonPushed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Switches to the add appointment scene.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • appointmentModifyButtonPushed

        public void appointmentModifyButtonPushed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        If an appointment is selected, that appointment is loaded into the modify appointment scene. If no appointment is selected, an error is displayed to the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • appointmentDeleteButtonPushed

        public void appointmentDeleteButtonPushed()
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        If an appointment is selected, the user is asked to confirm the deletion of the appointment. If the user selected yes, the appointment is deleted and the appointment tableview is updated. The user is alerted upon successful deletion. Otherwise, nothing changes. if no appointment is selected, an error is displayed to the user.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • updateAppointmentTableView

        public void updateAppointmentTableView()
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates the appointment tableview with the appointment data from the database. The data can be further filtered by radio buttons.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • checkUpcomingAppointments

        public void checkUpcomingAppointments()
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is called upon a successful user login. Tests if a user has an appointment within the next 15 minutes. If there are any appointments, the user is notified and given the option to view the upcoming appointment details. If there are none found, the user is notified there are no upcoming appointments.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • customerAddButtonPushed

        public void customerAddButtonPushed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Switches to the add customer scene.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • customerModifyButtonPushed

        public void customerModifyButtonPushed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        If a customer is selected, that customer is loaded into the modify customer scene. If no customer is selected, and error is displayed to the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • customerDeleteButtonPushed

        public void customerDeleteButtonPushed()
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        If a customer is selected, the database is checked to see if the customer has any appointments. If there are no appointments, the user is asked to confirm the deletion of the customer. If the user selects yes, the customer is deleted and the customer view is updated. The user is alerted upon successful deletion. Otherwise, nothing changes. If no customer was selected, an error is displayed to the user.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • updateCustomerTableView

        public void updateCustomerTableView()
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates the customer table view with the customer data from the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • noneSelectedAlert

        public void noneSelectedAlert​(java.lang.String object)
        Alerts the user if an item was not properly selected.
        Parameters:
        object - the item that was not selected

      • confirmDeletionAlert

        public boolean confirmDeletionAlert​(java.lang.String objectType,
                                    java.lang.String objectName)
        Confirms if the user would like to delete the selected object.
        Parameters:
        objectType - the type of object to be deleted
        objectName - the name of the object to be deleted
        Returns:
        true if the user has confirmed the deletion. false if the user cancels.

      • deletionSuccessfulAlert

        public void deletionSuccessfulAlert​(java.lang.String object)
        Notifies the user that an item was successfully deleted.
        Parameters:
        object - the object that was deleted
